late-onset
cancer. A high-throughput screen of a natural product fraction library
identified fractions derived from an aqueous extract of Sinularia 1 4 7 11 2 3 8 9 Center for Cancer Research 10.13039/100031022 75N91019D00024 Center for Cancer Research 10.13039/100031022 HHSN261200800001E Center for Cancer Research 10.13039/100031022 ZIA BC 011471 Center for Cancer Research 10.13039/100031022 ZIA BC 011657 Center for Cancer Research 10.13039/100031022 ZIA BC 011904 pmc-status-qastatus 0 pmc-status-live yes pmc-status-embargo no pmc-status-released yes pmc-prop-open-access yes pmc-prop-olf no pmc-prop-manuscript no pmc-prop-legally-suppressed no pmc-prop-has-pdf yes pmc-prop-has-supplement yes pmc-prop-pdf-only no pmc-prop-suppress-copyright no pmc-prop-is-real-version no pmc-prop-is-scanned-article no pmc-prop-preprint no pmc-prop-in-epmc yes document-id-old-9 np5c00786 document-id-new-14 np5c00786 production-flag-MathML-config-version 3 production-flag-journal-citation-display-style acs-no-titles production-flag-journal-date-display-style dates-used-rcd-rvd-acc production-flag-si-avail yes document-id-alt-64 ec3fab268b306f0db36c788f4097f19022c102d555bdab61cb952c803a4d4525 Soft corals (on the order of
Alcyonacea) are sessile benthic organisms. Anatomically, the majority
of the organism is comprised of soft tissue, a proteinaceous hydroskeleton
with embedded calcareous support structures (sclerites).  Sinularia   Sinularia Sarcophyton Eunicea Clavularia Nephthea Lobophytum  ε   Diffuse pleural mesothelioma (DPM)
is a rare aggressive malignancy
affecting the mesothelial cells in the pleural lining surrounding
the lungs often related to asbestos exposure.     In a recent DPM oriented high-throughput screening campaign using
a fractionated natural product library, fractions from an extract
of Sinularia 1 4 7 11 5 6 12 13 Results and Discussion Despite the need for treatment
options for DPM, few large-scale
high-throughput drug discovery campaigns have been published directly
assessing the effect of small molecules on the growth of mesothelioma
cell lines. Figure 1 Primary
screening outcomes. (A) Violin plot showing the distribution
of all marine primary screening fractions and mesothelioma cell line-specific
activity. (B) The behavior of all NPNPD fractions derived from the Sinularia The resulting pure natural products were tested
for DPM specificity
by counter-screening against a patient-derived normal pleura mesothelial
cell line, NP1. Figure S1 Figure S1 Data analysis following primary screening
of ∼34,000 marine
fractions against the two DPM cell lines revealed that most samples
did not significantly reduce viability in either cell line, resulting
in a median reading of 81% viability ( Figure Figure Sinularia Figure Sinularia 1 4 7 11 5 6 12 13 Sinulariolone

namely, sinulariolones B–J ( 1 4 7 11 5 6 12 13 Experimental Section General Experimental Procedures Optical rotations were
measured on a Rudolph research analytical AUTOPOL IV automatic polarimeter
using a cell of 0.25 dm path length at 25 °C, and UV spectra
were measured with an HP 8453 UV–vis spectrophotometer. ECD
experiments were performed on a J-1500 CD spectrophotometer, and IR
spectra were recorded with a Bruker ALPHA II FT-IR spectrometer. NMR
spectra were obtained with: (a) a Bruker Avance III NMR spectrometer
equipped with a 3 mm CP TCI probe operating at a frequency of 600
